# Warmer Damm

| created =
| operator =
| status =
| open =
}}
The Warmer Damm is a public park in the centre of Wiesbaden, Germany, stretching from the Wilhelmstraße to  the southern borders of the Kurpark and lying immediately in front of the Hessian State Theater. It was created between 1860 and 1861 as an English landscape park and includes a pond.
Gallery
File:Warmer Damm Promenade.JPG|A treed promenade of the Warmer Damm, running adjacent to Wilhelmstraße
File:Warmer Damm Planting.JPG|A garden of the Warmer Damm
File:Warmer Damm-2 Wiesbaden.jpg|The big pond
File:Staatstheater Wiesbaden Schillerdenkmal.jpg|The Schiller monument and the state theater
File:Marktkirche seen from the Warmer Damm, Wiesbaden, Germany.JPG|Marktkirche seen from the Warmer Damm
References
*The information in this article is based on that in its German equivalent.
